sentences.en: A small crowd attempted to pull down a statue.
sentences.cn: 一小伙人试图推倒一尊塑像。

sentences.en: A vast crowd gathered in the main square.
sentences.cn: 主广场上聚集了一大群人。

sentences.en: As she finished each song, the crowd clapped wildly.
sentences.cn: 她每唱完一首歌，人群就拼命鼓掌。

sentences.en: He blended in with the crowd at the art sale.
sentences.cn: 他混入了艺术品拍卖会的人群中。

sentences.en: He charged into the crowd. "Break it up," he shouted.
sentences.cn: 他冲进人群，大喊道：“散开。”

sentences.en: He heard muttering from the front of the crowd.
sentences.cn: 他听到人群前面有人在小声嘀咕什么。

sentences.en: He wanted to go unnoticed, to be one of the crowd.
sentences.cn: 他想默默无闻地做个普通人。

sentences.en: His tax-cutting pledge brought a delirious crowd to their feet.
sentences.cn: 他减税的承诺让亢奋的人群欢呼雀跃起来。

sentences.en: Holidaymakers crowded the beaches.
sentences.cn: 海滩上挤满了度假者。

sentences.en: Hundreds of people crowded into the church for the funeral.
sentences.cn: 数百人拥进教堂参加葬礼。

sentences.en: Hundreds of tightly rolled newspapers were set aflame among the 50,000 crowd.
sentences.cn: 几百张卷紧的报纸在为数5万的人群中被点燃。

sentences.en: I didn’t know him; he wasn’t one of the usual crowd.
sentences.cn: 我不认识他，他不是平时那一群人里的。

sentences.en: I'm depressed by the bovine enthusiasm of the crowd's response.
sentences.cn: 人群毫无热情的迟钝反应使我感到很沮丧。

sentences.en: Saturday’s game was watched by a capacity crowd (= the maximum number of people that a sports ground etc can hold ) .
sentences.cn: 星期六的比赛座无虚席。

sentences.en: She mingled with the crowd of guests, exchanging greetings.
sentences.cn: 她穿梭在宾客中间和他们打招呼。

sentences.en: The crowd around the bench began to melt away.
sentences.cn: 长椅周围的人群渐渐散去了。

sentences.en: The crowd in Robinson's Coffee-House was thinning, but only by degrees.
sentences.cn: 鲁宾逊咖啡屋里的人正在变少，但也只是渐少而已。

sentences.en: The crowd moved indoors for what were deemed the most desirable items.
sentences.cn: 人群为了被视为最值得拥有的物品涌入屋里。

sentences.en: The organisers have to employ performers to pull a crowd.
sentences.cn: 组织者不得不雇些演员来聚拢人气。

sentences.en: The small British crowd roared themselves hoarse, waving their Union Jacks.
sentences.cn: 一小群英国人挥舞着国旗，吼得嗓子都沙哑了。

sentences.en: The whole thing was a masterpiece of crowd management.
sentences.cn: 整件事情就是人群管理的典范。

sentences.en: Three mortar shells had landed close to a crowd of people.
sentences.cn: 3枚迫击炮弹落在人群旁。

sentences.en: Troops fired tear gas and shots to disperse a crowd of 15,000 demonstrators.
sentences.cn: 军队发射催泪弹并开枪来驱散15,000名示威群众。

phrases.tran_cn: 扬帆加速：张起众多的风帆以加速行驶

trans.tran_cn: 人群，观众，一伙人，老百姓，群众
trans.tran_en: a large group of people who have gathered together to do something, for example to watch something or protest about something

trans.tran_cn: 聚集在…，逼近，（使）拥挤，涌上心头
trans.tran_en: if people crowd somewhere, they gather together in large numbers, filling a particular place
if people crowd somewhere, they gather together in large numbers, filling a particular place

trans.tran_cn: 挤满， 塞满； 挤， 推
trans.tran_en: if people or things crowd a place, there are a lot of them there
